bibl.title: Letter from Arlyne C. Fransway to Philip Showalter Hench, October 7, 1952

div1.p: Fransway, Armstrong's secretary, informs Hench that Armstrong will be unable to attend the dedication of Camp Lazear. However, Streit will be available for the ceremony.

div1.head: Letter from Arlyne C. Fransway to Philip Showalter Hench, October 7, 1952
div1.opener:
DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE
IN REPLY REFER TO
DEPARTMENT OF THE ARMY
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
WASHINGTON 25, D.C.
7 OCTOBER 1952
Philip S. Hench, M.D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
In the temporary absence of General Armstrong may I take the
liberty of acknowledging your letter of 29 September.

I note that the date of the dedication of Camp Lazear is being
postponed until presumably December 3rd and that you are hopeful
that General Armstrong will find it possible to be with you on that
date.

After checking General Armstrong's calendar, I am sorry to say
that his schedule for the entire month of December is completely
filled and that on the 3rd of December he will be in Denver attend-
ing the American Medical Association meeting.

However, I talked to General Paul Streit today telling him of
the change in date and he informs me that he will be available for
the dedication on December 3rd.
May we hear from you again as to final plans for the dedication.

closer.signed:
Arlyne C. Fransway
Secretary to General Armstrong
